name: Tetro Squares (Payal Chana)
description:
Tetro Squares is a top-down, 2D puzzle game where the player controls a single square and moves around using grid-based movement. There are other squares around the grid that the player's square connects to and moves together as one.

There are also spikes around that destroy a connected square each time the player moves into it. The player's goal is to strategically complete the specific polyominoes in each level.

This was heavily inspired by Tetris and the idea of Tetrominoes. Tetrominoes are shapes created with squares that are connected to each other. This led to the goal of the game of trying to create specific polyominoes, which are the same as Tetrominoes except that they can be made of any number of squares. 

This game was created with the help of Michael Parkin and Ashish Juggpal. Thank you for working on this with me!

Date: August 2021
